summary.text:
Pattern class.
The core building block of Sartori. Patterns represent time-varying values over cycles.
Compare values. If both are true, return 1, else 0.

content.text:
```ts
coin().and(coin()) // returns 1 when both coins() are true
```

```ts
cat('A', 'B', 'C') // A for 1 cycle, B for 1 cycle, C for 1 cycle.
```

summary.text: Randomly choose from a set of values.

content.text:
```ts
choose('A', 'B', 'C') // randomly chooses A, B, or C each cycle.
```

summary.text: Clamp pattern values to a given range.

content.text:
```ts
random().mul(10).clamp(2, 4) // clamps random()*10 values to between 2 and 4
```

summary.text: Return an equal distribution of 1s and 0s.

content.text:
```ts
coin()
```

summary.text: Generate a cosine wave from min to max over one cycle

content.text:
```ts
cosine(0, 1) // a cosine wave from 0 to 1 over the course of 1 cycle
```

summary.text: quantization: steps/cycle. Default 48. Increase for a more fine-grained waveform.
Return the current cycles per second.

content.text:
```ts
(4).ctms() // convert a number as a method
```

```ts
ctms(1) // or as a function
```

```ts
'1 2 3 4'.ctms() // convert a mini pattern string
```

```ts
seq(1,2,3,4).ctms() // convert a Pattern
```

```ts
(4).cts() // convert a number as a method
```

```ts
cts(1) // or as a function
```

```ts
'1 2 3 4'.cts() // convert a mini pattern string
```

```ts
seq(1,2,3,4).cts() // convert a Pattern
```

```ts
sine().degrade(0.3) // randomly replaces 30% of sine wave values with 0
```

```ts
seq('A', 'B', 'C').fast(3) // A for 1/3 cycle, B for 1/3 cycle, C for 1/3 cycle.
```

summary.text: speed-up factor. Can be a number or a Pattern.

content.text:
```ts
sine().interp(saw()) // interpolates between sine and saw waveforms over time
```

summary.text: Parse a mini pattern string into a Pattern instance.

content.text:
```ts
mini('Cmaj7..?') // parses the mini pattern string into a Pattern
```

summary.text: Modulo by a value or pattern.
Map from one range to another.

content.text:
```ts
often()
```

summary.text: Compare values. If one of them is true, return 1, else 0.

content.text:
```ts
coin().or(coin()) // returns 1 when either coin() is true
```

summary.text: Generate a pulse wave from min to max over one cycle.

content.text:
```ts
pulse(0, 1, 0.25) // a pulse wave from 0 to 1 with a duty cycle of 25% over the course of 1 cycle
```

summary.text: quantization: steps/cycle. Default 48. Increase for a more fine-grained waveform.

content.text:
```ts
rarely()
```

summary.text: Generate a ramp from min to max, once per cycle.

content.text:
```ts
saw(0,4) // a ramp from 0 to 4 over the course of 1 cycle
```

```ts
saw(0,1,96).slow(2) // a ramp from 0 to 1 over the course of 2 cycles, with finer steps to mitigate the slow pattern
```

summary.text: quantization: steps/cycle. Default 48. Increase for a more fine-grained waveform.
Sequence values into a single cycle.

content.text:
```ts
seq('A', 'B', 'C', 'D') // A for .25 cycle, B for .25 cycle ... D for .25 cycle
```

summary.text: Generate a sine wave from min to max over one cycle.

content.text:
```ts
sine(0, 1) // a sine wave from 0 to 1 over the course of 1 cycle
```

```ts
sine(-1, 1, 96).slow(2) // a sine wave from -1 to 1 over the course of 2 cycles, with finer steps to mitigate the slow pattern
```

summary.text: quantization: steps/cycle. Default 48. Increase for a more fine-grained waveform.

content.text:
```ts
seq('A', 'B', 'C').slow(2) // A for 2 cycles, B for 2 cycles, C for 2 cycles.
```

summary.text: Return an equal distribution of 1s and 0s.

content.text:
```ts
coin()
```

summary.text: Alias for pulse with a duty cycle of 0.5.

content.text:
```ts
square(0, 4) // a square wave from 0 to 4 over the course of 1 cycle
```

summary.text: Layer values over the same time range.

content.text:
```ts
stack(0, sine(), square()) // layers a sine wave and square wave over a constant 0 value.
```

summary.text: Generate a triangle wave from min to max over one cycle

content.text:
```ts
tri(0, 1) // a triangle wave from 0 to 1 over the course of 1 cycle
```

summary.text: quantization: steps/cycle. Default 48. Increase for a more fine-grained waveform.
Compare values. If one is true and the other is false, return 1, else 0.

content.text:
```ts
set(1).xor(1) // returns 0
```

readme.text:
# Sartori
A live coding language for unlimited pattern interference. Supercedes [Zen](https://github.com/cephasteom/zen).

# Credits
* This series of blog posts by Froos helped me finally crack time: [garten.salat.dev](https://garten.salat.dev/idlecycles/). Many, many thanks.
